title: World of Warcraft is getting two major changes in Midnight that are already dividing the community
body_text: Related reads:World of Warcraft: Midnight – The First Hands-On Preview World of Warcraft is on the brink of two of the biggest changes the game has ever seen. Two changes that already seem to divide the WoW community, with many supporters and opponents. With the release of the next expansion – Midnight – Blizzard will block the use of certain combat addons and make all classes in the game significantly easier to play. All classes will have fewer abilities, making rotations easier to execute. This should mean that addons are no longer needed to properly complete boss fights, and WoW is taking a much-needed direction that has been inevitable for years. The game had become too complex for newcomers, and the two main culprits are now being addressed. But, as mentioned, not everyone is happy about it. The big benefit of addons The discussion about the difficulty of the game and the impact of third-party addons has been ongoing for quite some time. Hardcore players who do nothing but play World of Warcraft have been using addons for years and know them inside and out. They can hardly imagine the game without these community-made additions – and rightly so! Addons have often made World of Warcraft more accessible and clearer. For example, there is the addon Weakauras, which lets you customize your game and add alerts. These range from simple things like “don’t forget to summon your pet!” to complex systems that provide more information to deaf players than Blizzard itself offers. For instance, there is a guild made up entirely of deaf players who say that thanks to this addon, they can also complete the game’s toughest content. The tools Blizzard provides are simply insufficient, and this is one of the groups concerned about the upcoming changes. Was I a Good Addon? by u/nothix in wow Addons had become such a major part of the game that Blizzard even started designing bosses with the knowledge that players would create tools to help the entire community defeat them. The top raiding guilds, competing to be the first to kill the final boss on Mythic difficulty, even had Weakaura creators in their teams who built new alerts on the fly to give raiders more information during fights. This will all come to an end when Midnight launches. In the Midnight alpha, available for about a week now, players are getting their first look at Blizzard’s built-in “addons.” Blizzard acknowledges that players do need extra information in some cases, but they no longer want this to come from addons. Instead, several features will be integrated directly into the game. You can now create Weakaura-like displays for your cooldowns, a built-in boss alert system is replacing Deadly Boss Mods and similar addons, and a damage meter is being added. Unfortunately, at the time of writing, these features are far less comprehensive than the addons players have been relying on for years. A new way of playing is coming This could simply be because Midnight is still in its alpha phase and many features are yet to be added based on player feedback. For example, I expect Blizzard to look at accessibility options for deaf players, as accessibility is very important to them. But I especially expect gameplay as a whole to shift. When classes are simplified and addons less extensive, bosses will also need to be adjusted. Hardcore players still want to be challenged to the max, and Blizzard intends to deliver that. Rotations will be easier and there will be fewer addon warnings, so the structure of boss fights must change. I think Blizzard will focus more on dodging attacks and completing tasks during fights, rather than emphasizing perfect rotations and passing healing or damage checks. Of course, these elements already exist in the game, but I believe they will become even more central. In my opinion, these are all welcome changes, since they address problems I’ve personally run into, and I believe the game needs them. Even though hardcore players won’t like it, and there are still many improvements to be made to the new features at this stage. I used to be a hardcore player myself. I raided four nights a week on Mythic, played multiple characters, and practically all my gaming time went into WoW. But now that I’m older and have more responsibilities, I often play the game with months-long breaks. What always gets in my way is that when I return, I first spend two hours updating addons, reading on WoWHead about the best single- and multi-target rotations, and checking in-game “where was I again?” By the time I finish all that, I’ve already lost the motivation to play. I know WoW friends of mine face the same issue, and I think integrating addons into the base game and simplifying classes will help with this problem – especially when playing multiple characters. It becomes much more appealing to play several characters if you don’t need to be a rocket scientist to play them all effectively. Recommending World of Warcraft to your friends will become much easier It will also be much easier to recommend the game. I always talk enthusiastically about World of Warcraft to my friends who don’t play it, and sometimes I convince them to try. But often, they quit after just a few hours. Their character suddenly became very complicated to play, veteran players expected them to have all the addons installed to share information, and the story was nearly impossible to understand. That last part is something Blizzard still needs to figure out, since solving narrative issues in a 20-year-old game is even harder. But at least with Midnight, I feel more confident recommending the game to my friends, since they won’t need addons and classes are much easier to grasp. I cannot stress enough how important this is for the game. It’s amazing that WoW has attracted so many hardcore players for 20 years, but that group is shrinking over time. Players have kids or other responsibilities, move on to different games, or become casual WoW players like me. The game needs a steady influx of new players, or it will slowly fade away. I’m very curious if World of Warcraft can attract a new generation – currently only interested in Fortnite and Roblox. I would find it a shame if WoW dies a slow death, because I still dream of playing it with my WoW buddies when I retire, with endless free time. Most likely from our couches, since these changes also hint that World of Warcraft is preparing for a console release, where fewer buttons and no need for addons become even more important. But that may be a discussion for later. For now, it’s time for Midnight, and in the coming months we’ll find out how these changes will affect one of the most iconic games of all time. Related reads:World of Warcraft: Midnight Cinematic Images and First Screenshots

title: A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms Showrunner Explains the Big Difference With Game of Thrones That Fans Will Instantly Notice
body_text: Related reads:HBO Max Chief Reveals 2026 Release Months for Game of Thrones Spinoff a Knight of the Seven Kingdoms and House of the Dragon Series 3 The showrunner of A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms has explained one of the big differences with the other two Game of Thrones series.A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms, due out on HBO Max in January 2026, adapts George R. R. Martin’s Tales of Dunk and Egg novella trilogy, itself a prequel to Game of Thrones set 90 years before the events of the main books.It's a significant release for HBO Max, but it differs from Game of Thrones and prior spinoff House of the Dragon in a number of key ways, one of which will be sure to spark an instant reaction from fans.Warning! Spoilers for A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms follows:As detailed by Entertainment Weekly, A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms does not have an opening title sequence. This is particularly surprising given Game of Thrones’ iconic opening sequence, which is embedded in the memory of an army of fans.Instead, as EW described it, A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms has “a simple title card with medieval typography in between the beginning action of each episode.”Showrunner Ira Parker said the decision was made due to the type of show A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms is and who its characters, Ser Duncan the Tall and Egg, are.“All decisions came down to Dunk, trying to channel the type of person he is into every aspect of this show, even the title sequence," Parker explained.“The title sequences on the original [Game of Thrones] and House of the Dragon are big and epic and incredible. Ramin Djawadi’s score is orchestral and large and beautiful. That's not really Dunk’s M.O. He’s plain and he’s simple and he’s to-the-point. He doesn't have a lot of flash to him.”Don’t expect dragons and a big, magical scale to this show, either. “Nobody's thinking about magic,” Parker said. “This could basically be 14th century Britain. This is hard nose, grind it out, gritty, medieval knights, cold with a really light, hopeful touch. It's a wonderful place to be. We are ground up in this series, we are starting right at the bottom. We're not with the lords and ladies, the kings and queens."In March this year, House of the Dragon showrunner Ryan Condal called Game of Thrones author George R.R. Martin’s criticisms of the series’ second season “disappointing.”Drama in the Game of Thrones world began when Martin promised to dive into “everything that’s gone wrong with House of the Dragon” in August last year. It’s a promise he kept, going on to call out plot elements related to Aegon and Helaena’s children as he expressed concern for how future seasons of the show might play out. The post was eventually removed from the author’s website without explanation but not before thousands of fans — and HBO — caught wind of the grievances it presented.But Martin sounds a lot more enthusiastic about A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms than House of the Dragon — Martin teased earlier this year that he couldn’t wait to see Dunk and Egg’s story come to TV screens.“I’ve seen all six episodes now (the last two in rough cuts, admittedly), and I loved them," Martin said in a blog post in January. "Dunk and Egg have always been favorites of mine, and the actors we found to portray them are just incredible. The rest of the cast are terrific as well. Wait until you guys meet the Laughing Storm and Tanselle Too-Tall.”Martin continued to celebrate A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms, adding: “It’s as faithful an adaptation as a reasonable man could hope for (and you all know how incredibly reasonable I am on that particular subject).”Despite Martin’s towering praise, we’ve seen little from the show since it was announced in 2021. After locking in actors Peter Claffey and Dexter Sol Ansell to play Ser Duncan the Tall and Egg, respectively, HBO went on to reveal one image from the show in June 2024. A brief teaser trailer followed in August, showing a glimpse at some of the series’ major players and a few shots of familiar Game of Thrones action.House of the Dragon Season 3, meanwhile, is set for release early summer 2026. In a separate interview with Deadline, June was suggested.Wesley is Director, News at IGN. Find him on Twitter at @wyp100. You can reach Wesley at wesley_yinpoole@ign.com or confidentially at wyp100@proton.me. Related reads:George R.R. Martin Calls Game of Thrones Show a Knight of the Seven Kingdoms 'As Faithful an Adaptation as a Reasonable Man Could Hope For'

title: Nato-generalsekretær Mark Rutte besøger Danmark igen | B.T.
body_text: PolitikI dag kl. 15.25Opdateret i dag kl. 15.25Nato-generalsekretær Mark Rutte besøger Danmark igenNato meddeler, at Mark Rutte lægger vejen forbi Danmark for at mødes med statsminister Mette Frederiksen.Lyt KøForsvarsalliancen Nato meddeler på sin hjemmeside, at Natos generalsekretær, Mark Rutte, i dag, mandag, kommer til Danmark for at mødes med statsminister Mette Frederiksen (S).Det fremgår ikke af meddelelsen, hvad de to skal snakke sammen om.Mark Rutte var også i Danmark i sidste uge.Her var han torsdag i Bella Centret i København i forbindelse med et møde i Det Europæiske Politiske Fællesskab (EPC).Ritzau har været i kontakt med Statsministeriet, som hverken vil be- eller afkræfte besøget på nuværende tidspunkt./ritzau/

title: Eksperter varslede stop: Eriksen stikker tilbage | B.T.
body_text: FodboldI dag kl. 15.45Eksperter varslede stop: Eriksen stikker tilbageJonas RyefeltJournalistLyt KøFlere eksperter udtalte, at Christian Eriksen kunne finde på at stoppe karrieren, men det var aldrig i tankerne.Landsholdskoryfæerne Thomas Gravesen fra Viaplay og Lars Jacobsen fra TV 2 luftede begge muligheden for, at Christian Eriksen kunne finde på at stoppe karrieren, da han i over to måneder ikke havde nogen klub.Nåede du at blive provokeret over de røster, der sagde, at du nok stoppede?»Jeg har ikke hørt fra Lars (Jacobsen, red.), der vist var den første, der sagde, at jeg skulle stoppe. Jeg har ikke haft nogen tanker eller intentioner om at stoppe til fodbold,« siger Eriksen i landsholdslejren.Den fynske TV 2-ekspert med tilnavnet 'Landsholds-Lars' kunne dog ikke få Eriksen ud af busken for at udrydde alle misforståelser.Havde du lyst til at gå ud og sige 'stop, stop, det er slet ikke sådan det er.'?»Jeg synes, det kom bedre ud efter, så man kunne se, at jeg ikke stoppede. Så fik jeg bevist det den vej gennem, for det var ikke noget, som jeg havde behov for at bekræfte,« siger Eriksen på B.T.s spørgsmål.»Hvis man skulle starte på det, så var der mange ting, jeg skulle bekræfte.«B.T. kunne fortælle i starten af september fortælle, at Eriksen ikke manglede tilbud, men mange kom fra eksotiske egne som New York, Gremio fra Brasilien, den walisiske Hollywood-klub, Wrexham, og klubber fra Sydkorea, Japan, Saudi-Arabien og De forenede Arabiske Emirater.Var der ingen af de tilbud, der lokkede lidt?»Det var kun i Europa.«»Tanken om at spille i en top 5-liga og være med omkring det danske landshold og spille med til VM vægtede højere end at tage et eksotisk sted hen og slappe lidt mere af.«Danmark møder Belarus og Grækenland henholdsvis torsdag og søndag.B.T. FodboldMoukoko-kvaler, Nartey-nøl i mixed zone, Højlunds hævnI dagens episode taler panelet blandt andet om FCK's trupkvaler, om et misset taktikmøde, om Brøndbys midtbanediamant, om AGF's vilde optur, om Rasmus Højlund og meget mere. Vært: Lasse Vøge Medvært: Johnny Wojciech Kokborg Producer: Teis Thornberg Programansvarlig: Niels Philip KjeldsenVis mere6. oktober31 minLyt KøSe alle episoder

title: Israel: Dansk aktivist fra Gaza-flotille er blandt deporterede | B.T.
body_text: UdlandI dag kl. 15.45Opdateret i dag kl. 15.45Israel: Dansk aktivist fra Gaza-flotille er blandt deporteredeEn talsperson fra organisationen Free Gaza Movement bekræfter, at en dansker har været tilbageholdt i Israel.Lyt Kø171 aktivister fra en nødhjælpsflotille med kurs mod Gaza, som Israel stoppede i sidste uge, er blevet deporteret - herunder mindst én dansker.Det oplyser Israels udenrigsministerium i et opslag på X.Gruppen er blevet deporteret til henholdsvis Grækenland og Slovakiet.Talsperson fra organisationen Free Gaza Movement Bent Erik Krøyer bekræfter over for Ritzau, at en dansk kvinde har været tilbageholdt i Israel efter at have været om bord på et skib i flotillen.Han fortæller, at forventningen har været, at hun skulle deporteres.- Det glæder mig meget, at det formentlig er hende, der er på vej hjem. For det har været hårdt at være fængslet dernede, siger han.Aktivisterne, som er blevet deporteret, kommer fra en lang række lande.Der er foruden Danmark tale om Grækenland, Italien, Frankrig, Irland, Sverige, Polen, Tyskland, Bulgarien, Litauen, Østrig, Luxemburg, Finland, Slovakiet, Schweiz, Norge, Storbritannien, Serbien og USA.Blandt dem er den svenske aktivist Greta Thunberg, der kan ses på flere billeder, som Israels udenrigsministerium har offentliggjort på X.- Vedhæftet er billeder af Greta og andre deltagere i dette PR-stunt i lufthavnen, før de blev deporteret, skriver ministeriet.Flotillen blev arrangeret af initiativet Global Sumud Flotilla.Global Sumud Flotilla oplyste natten til torsdag i sidste uge, at Israels militær havde stoppet 13 af flotillen skibe, mens 30 skibe sejlede videre mod Gaza.De resterende skibe blev stoppet af flåden i de efterfølgende dage, og aktivisterne om bord blev transporteret til Israel.En anden flotille, som den danske folketingspolitiker Victoria Velasquez (EL) er en del af, er stadig på vej til Gaza med nødhjælp.Denne flotille befinder sig mandag i Middelhavet nord for den egyptiske by Alexandria.Ifølge Bent Erik Krøyer fra Free Gaza Movement sejler en række danskere med denne flotille./ritzau/

title: Genåbnet Tyra-felt sender gassen videre til resten af Europa | B.T.
body_text: ErhvervI dag kl. 15.39Opdateret i dag kl. 15.39Genåbnet Tyra-felt sender gassen videre til resten af EuropaDet renoverede Tyra-felt indvies mandag og kan producere dobbelt så meget gas, som der er brug for i Danmark.Lyt KøDet kan virke en smule paradoksalt, at genåbningen af Tyra-feltet i Nordsøen markeres med en højtidelighed i Esbjerg mandag.I hvert fald når det nu engang er besluttet at gøre Danmark helt fri af kul, olie og gas fra 2050.Men der vil fortsat være brug for gassen fra Nordsøen en rum tid endnu. Om ikke her, så andre steder, forklarer Martin Næsby, der er direktør for brancheforeningen Dansk Offshore.- Europa har et kæmpebehov for gas, ikke bare i de næste fem-ti år, og det kan vi bidrage til at dække, så der skal importeres mindre flydende gas fra eksempelvis USA og Qatar - eller naturgas fra Rusland.- Og så er det mere klimavenligt at pumpe gassen ind fra Nordsøen end at transportere den i flydende form med tankskibe langvejs fra, siger direktøren.Tyra-feltet blev oprindeligt indviet i 1984, men med tiden har havbunden sænket sig, og derfor blev det i 2017 år af sikkerhedshensyn besluttet at renovere installationerne.Covid 19-pandemien og efterfølgende logistiske problemer betød, at det nye Tyra-felt først blev taget i drift i marts 2024.Det er nu oppe på omkring 90 procent af den forventede maksimalproduktion på 2,8 milliarder kubikmeter.Det svarer godt og vel til det dobbelte af Danmarks nuværende gasforbrug.Spørger man Brian Vad Mathiesen, der er professor i energiplanlægning ved Aalborg Universitet, var udfaldet af diskussionen om at renovere Tyra-feltet nok blevet en anden, hvis den var foregået i dag.- Dengang var den offentlige debat et andet sted, og i dag vil man nok mene, at det er langt vigtigere at investere i at reducere vores gasforbrug yderligere end at bruge arbejdskraft og penge på at lave nye felter.- Men man må omvendt også sige, at når vi nu har noget, der reducerer vores afhængighed af flydende naturgas og bidrager til den europæiske forsyningssikkerhed, så er det fint at få noget ekstra ud af det, vi har i forvejen, og så ellers kigge fremad, siger han.Gassen fra Tyra-feltet kan enten sendes ind til det danske fastland via en gasledning til Esbjerg, eller det kan sendes sydpå via den såkaldte Nogat-rørledning, der går i land ved hollandske Den Helder.Formelt er det Dansk Undergrunds Consortium (DUC), der har rettighederne til at udvide olie og gas i Nordsøen.DUC ejes af den danske stat, Bluenord og energiselskabet Total Energies, hvis datterselskab Total E&P Danmark står for den praktiske opgave med at pumpe olie og gas op af undergrunden.Total E&P Danmark hed indtil 2017 Mærsk Oil og var ejet af A.P. Møller-Mærsk-koncernen./ritzau/

title: Politiet melder ud: Advarer om maskeret mand  | B.T.
body_text: KrimiI dag kl. 15.37Politiet melder ud: Advarer om maskeret mand Per BørdingJournalistLyt KøPolitiet i Silkeborg er på jagt efter en maskeret mand.Myndighederne har overvågningsbilleder, der viser ham gående rundt i byen klokken fire natten til søndag, men har endnu ikke fået ham identificeret.Det skriver TV Midtvest.I weekenden blev der registreret seks indbrud i Silkeborg. Fire af dem i Buskelund/Hvinningdal-området.Der blev stjålet både smykker og kontanter.Til mediet siger Stephan Weber, der er politikommissær ved lokalpolitiet i Silkeborg:»Det her er usædvanligt meget i forhold til normalen. Det tyder på, at der er er nogen, der mere systematisk er i gang lige nu. Derfor vil vi meget høre fra borgere i området, der har observeret noget usædvanligt eller ligger inde med overvågningsvideo.«Alle indbrud er foregået på samm måde: glas i en rude fjernes eller knuses, mens indbyggerne ikke er hjemme.

title: Guardiola når milepæl og byder Ferguson og Wenger på middag | B.T.
body_text: FodboldI dag kl. 15.35Guardiola når milepæl og byder Ferguson og Wenger på middagAlex Ferguson og Arsène Wenger er blevet overgået af Pep Guardiola, som nåede 250 sejre hurtigere i ligaen.Lyt KøPep Guardiola rundede søndag en milepæl, da han førte Manchester City til sejr nummer 250 i Premier League. Det skete med en kneben 1-0-sejr ude over Brentford.Dermed blev Guardiola medlem af en eksklusiv klub af trænere med 250 sejre i Premier League for én og samme klub.Kun Alex Ferguson og Arsène Wenger har præsteret det samme med henholdsvis Manchester United og Arsenal.- Det er en ære at være i Sir Alex Fergusons og Arsène Wengers selskab. Jeg vil invitere dem på en fin middag, siger Guardiola ifølge BBC Sport.Det tog Guardiola færre kampe at nå de 250 ligasejre end de to trænerlegender. 349 kampe skulle Guardiola bruge. Ferguson nåede milepælen efter 404 kampe, mens Wenger gjorde det på 424.- Det er en fornøjelse at være en del af Premier Leagues historie. Det er jeg meget tilfreds med. Nu går jeg efter 250 sejre mere, lyder det fra spanieren.David Moyes er også noteret for 250 sejre siden den første Premier League-sæson i 1992/1993. Det er dog sket med flere forskellige klubber. Og Moyes skulle bruge hele 625 kampe på bedriften.Guardiola er i gang med sin tiende sæson som Citys manager. Den 54-årige spanier har blandt andet ført holdet til seks engelske mesterskaber.Hvis man går længere tilbage i den bedste engelske fodboldrække, har 17 trænere nu opnået 250 sejre eller flere med én og samme klub. Det skriver BBC Sport.Blandt dem er nogle store navne. Heriblandt Bill Shankly for Liverpool, Matt Busby for Manchester United og Brian Clough for Nottingham Forest./ritzau/

title: Folketinget skal indhente erfaringer fra udlandet om mandatkøb | B.T.
body_text: PolitikI dag kl. 15.32Opdateret i dag kl. 15.32Folketinget skal indhente erfaringer fra udlandet om mandatkøbJustitsminister Peter Hummelgaard (S) skal indhente erfaringer, der skal forhindre mandatkøb.Lyt KøFolketinget søger mod udlandet for at indhente erfaringer, der kan bruges til at forhindre, at et mandat i Folketinget bliver købt af et parti.Det siger Folketingets formand og formand for Udvalget for Forretningsordenen (UFO) Søren Gade (V) mandag efter møde i UFO.- Nu er det blevet besluttet, at justitsministeren (Peter Hummelgaard (S), red.) indsamler erfaringer fra de lande, som har et regelsæt, hvor vi finder ud af, hvad det er for et regelsæt, de har, siger han.Folketingets lovsekretariat har fremlagt fire bud på, hvordan man kan forhindre, at partier tilbyder "økonomiske fordele" for at nedlægge et mandat.Spørgsmålet blev aktuelt, efter at Frihedsbrevet tidligere i år afslørede, at Moderaterne havde tilbudt Mike Fonseca penge for at nedlægge sit mandat.Det skete ved et møde, hvor Moderaternes formand, udenrigsminister Lars Løkke Rasmussen, fremlagde forslaget, som Mike Fonseca afviste.Sekretariatet anviser forskellige mulige veje.Enten kan man - på forskellig vis - ændre straffelovens regler for aktiv og passiv bestikkelse. Man kan ændre folketingsvalglovens regler for bestikkelse, eller man kan vedtage et kodeks.- Man kan prøve at få det ind i valgloven, i straffeloven, og man kan prøve at få et kodeks, som man har i andre lande.- Det bliver op til Folketinget at afgøre, hvilken vej man skal gå, siger Søren Gade.Sagen om Mike Fonseca og Moderaterne blev taget op af flere oppositionspartier, og i sommer krævede et flertal i Udvalget for Forretningsordenen, at mandatkøb skulle forbydes./ritzau/

title: Moderaterne opstiller otte partiansatte til kommunalvalget | B.T.
body_text: PolitikI dag kl. 15.29Opdateret i dag kl. 15.29Moderaterne opstiller otte partiansatte til kommunalvalgetTil kommunalvalget sætter Moderaterne otte af deres partiansatte fra sekretariatet på Christiansborg på valg.Lyt KøModeraterne opstiller en række af deres partiansatte i sekretariatet på Christiansborg til kommunalvalget i november.Det skriver partiet i en pressemeddelelse.Det drejer sig eksempelvis om pressechef Cecilie Fisker Nielsen, Frederiksberg, organisations- og udviklingschef Casper Hedegaard, København, og politisk chef Simon Boje Groth, København.I alt er der tale om, at otte partiansatte i Moderaternes sekretariat stiller op til kommunalvalget.- Jeg er stolt over, at så mange i partiet har lyst til at engagere sig - også vores egne medarbejdere, lyder det fra partisekretær i Moderaterne Britt Bager.Britt Bager, der har erfaring som folketingsmedlem for Venstre og De Konservative, stiller dog ikke selv op til kommunalvalget.Mandag klokken 12 var der frist for at indsende de endelige kandidatlister til valget, der løber af stablen den 18. november.Det er første gang, at Moderaterne stiller op til kommunal- og regionsrådsvalget.Partiet blev valgt ind i Folketinget for første gang ved valget i 2022, og nu skal man forsøge at blive repræsenteret i byrådene landet over.Moderaterne oplyser, at man i alt opstiller 270 kandidater i 71 kommuner.I august lød det fra partiet, at man ville være repræsenteret i 73 kommuner, og der er derfor faldet to kommuner fra i slutspurten.Ud over de nævnte partiansatte opstiller partiet også HR-chefen, Anna Peuliche Vogelsang, i Roskilde og den nationale kampagneleder, Asger Hagelund, i København.Dertil kommer de ansatte Frederik Lau Petersen, Rødovre, Andreas Raben, København, og Kasper-Peder von Bach, Odense.- Nu er holdet sat, og jeg ved, at alle vores dygtige og dedikerede kandidater er klar til at gøre en forskel i deres lokalområde, siger Britt Bager i pressemeddelelsen./ritzau/

title: Kritikere ser rødt: Svigersønnen er tilbage  | B.T.
body_text: UdlandI dag kl. 15.29Kritikere ser rødt: Svigersønnen er tilbage Sofie Amalie ElmelundJournalistLyt KøHan skal forhandle Gaza-planen på plads mandag, men det er alle ikke lige glade for. Jared Kushner, Donald Trumps svigersøn, er tilbage på den politiske scene. Han er taget til Egypten med Steve Witkoff, USAs særlige udsending, for at fortsætte forhandlinger med Israel og Hamas om en fredsplan.Men onde tunger hævder nu, at svigersønnen balancerer forretning og politik lidt for tæt. For 44-årige Jared Kushner har tjent masser af penge på Mellemøsten. Og derfor mener kritikere ikke, at han er den rette til at skulle stå for det, skriver flere internationale medier herunder The Times. Under den amerikanske præsident Donald Trumps første embedsperiode var ejendomsmægleren fra New Jersey en fast del af Trumpworld, hvor han fungerede som officiel rådgiver for præsidenten i alt fra reform af strafferetssystemet til Mellemøsten.Men han har ikke været lige så synlig i Det Ovale Kontor under Trumps anden embede. Jared Kushner og hans kone, Ivanka Trump, fik sig ifølge The Times lidt af en overraskelse over kravene til gennemsigtighed som fremtrædende skikkelser i Washington.Der var krav til dem om at skulle offentliggøre økonomiske oplysninger og konstant presseomtale. Kushner var blandt andet plaget af problemer med sikkerhedsgodkendelse og spørgsmål om lån til familiens ejendomsvirksomhed.Det skriver han om i sin erindringsbog, Breaking History. »Intet kunne have forberedt os på Washingtons voldsomhed – angrebene, efterforskningerne, de falske og saftige medierapporter, måske værst af alt, snakken i selve West Wing.«Derfor var det måske ikke den største overraskelse, da Kushner-parret meddelte, at de ikke ønskede at være en del af Trump-administrationen under præsidentens anden periode i Det Hvide Hus. I stedet har han udviklet sin investeringsfond Affinity Partners med flere tidligere embedsmænd fra Det Hvide Hus ansat og med penge fra nogle af de lande, som Jared Kushner arbejdede sammen med under Trumps første periode. Eksempelvis Saudi-Arabien. I september skrev Forbes desuden, at investeringer og støtter i Mellemøsten, har gjort Kushner til milliardær.Og selvom han ikke længere er bundet af embedets formelle forpligtelser, så mener kritikere at disse to ting er umulige at adskille. Og for Trump-administrationen er det netop det, der gør Kushner effektiv: Han er en mand med penge, forbindelser og loyalitet.

title: Gymnasier får over 100 millioner til fysiske bøger | B.T.
body_text: PolitikI dag kl. 15.16Opdateret i dag kl. 15.16Gymnasier får over 100 millioner til fysiske bøgerPengene skal bruges til at købe nye skønlitterære bøger i danskfaget. Pengene blev afsat i aftale fra 2016.Lyt KøRegeringen øremærker over 100 millioner kroner til nye fysiske bøger til gymnasierne i 2025 og 2026 for at styrke elevernes læselyst.Det skriver Børne- og Undervisningsministeriet i en pressemeddelelse mandag.Pengene skal bruges til at købe skønlitterære bøger lokalt på de forskellige gymnasier. Det skal blandt andet være bøger af forfattere i den nye og opdaterede litteraturkanon for danskfaget.Øremærkningen støttes af SF, Liberal Alliance, De Konservative, De Radikale og Dansk Folkeparti.Pengene kommer fra en aftale om styrkede gymnasiale uddannelser fra 2016, hvor der blev afsat 56,5 millioner kroner til "kvalitetsudvikling" i 2025 og 57,3 millioner kroner i 2026.Hensigten med de nye bøger er blandt andet at trække eleverne væk fra telefonen og computeren, siger børne- og undervisningsminister Mattias Tesfaye (S).- Vi skal have mere læselyst og mindre skærm. Derfor giver det mening at investere i rigtige bøger, man kan bladre i, tage med hjem og tale med andre om.- Når vi styrker adgangen til gode bøger, både klassikere og ny litteratur, ruster vi unge med evnen til fordybelse og kritisk tænkning, lyder det fra Mattias Tesfaye i pressemeddelelsen.Forfatterne i den nye kanon tæller blandt andre Inger Christensen, Tove Ditlevsen og Yahya Hassan.Den indeholder syv forfattere, som underviserne er forpligtet til at undervise i. Derudover indeholder listen 30 forfattere og genrer, hvoraf underviseren skal udvælge 12 til undervisningen.Ifølge formand for Danske Gymnasier Maja Bødtcher-Hansen er det noget helt andet at sidde med en fysisk bog frem for at læse på en skærm.- Vi har et ønske om at skabe tid og rum til mere fordybelse på gymnasierne, og det kan man blandt andet gennem bøger.Bøger kan åbne verden for elever på nye måder, og de allerbedste af dem får unge til at glemme sig selv for en stund. Det er en gave, når det sker, siger hun./ritzau/

title: Krim er allerede hårdt ramt af alvorlig benzinkrise – nu rammer Ukraine dets største oliedepot | Berlingske
body_text: InternationaltI dag kl. 15.50Krim er allerede hårdt ramt af alvorlig benzinkrise – nu rammer Ukraine dets største oliedepotNatten til mandag gennemførte Ukraine et droneangreb på det største oliedepot på den russisk-besatte Krim-halvø, der i forvejen er ramt af en omfattende benzinmangel. Ida Marie Holm JensenJournalistLyt Kø Gem artikelUkraine fortsætter de systematiske angreb på russiske olieanlæg.Natten til mandag har ukrainske droner angrebet olieterminalen i byen Feodosija – det største olielager på Krim-halvøen.

title: Nato-generalsekretær Mark Rutte besøger Danmark igen | Berlingske
body_text: PolitikI dag kl. 15.48Opdateret i dag kl. 15.48Nato-generalsekretær Mark Rutte besøger Danmark igenNato meddeler, at Mark Rutte lægger vejen forbi Danmark for at mødes med statsminister Mette Frederiksen.Lyt Kø Gem artikelForsvarsalliancen Nato meddeler på sin hjemmeside, at Natos generalsekretær, Mark Rutte, i dag, mandag, kommer til Danmark for at mødes med statsminister Mette Frederiksen (S).- Mandag 6. oktober rejser Natos generalsekretær, Mark Rutte, til København i Danmark for at mødes med den danske statsminister, Mette Frederiksen, skriver Nato på sin hjemmeside.Det fremgår ikke af meddelelsen, hvad de to skal snakke sammen om.Ritzau har været i kontakt med Statsministeriet, som hverken vil be- eller afkræfte besøget på nuværende tidspunkt.Mark Rutte var også i Danmark i sidste uge.Her var han torsdag i Bella Centret i København i forbindelse med et møde i Det Europæiske Politiske Fællesskab (EPC).Her holdt Mette Frederiksen blandt andet pressemøde med Ukraines præsident, Volodymyr Zelenskyj, hvis land siden 2022 har været i krig med nabolandet Rusland.Nato-lande har generelt været udsat for en del hændelser i den seneste tid.Det gælder også Danmark, hvor droner har fløjet over kritisk infrastruktur som lufthavne og militæranlæg.Forsvarets Efterretningstjeneste (FE) vurderede i sidste uge, at truslen for militære provokationer mod Nato-lande er høj.FE vurderer, at Rusland i øjeblikket fører en hybridkrig mod Danmark og Vesten.I vurderingen er blandt andet hensynsløs sejlads, simulerede angreb mod Nato-landes enheder og jamming af både civile og militære skibes og flys kommunikation og GPS-signaler nævnt som eksempler.Hertil kommer gentagne russiske krænkelser af Nato-landes luftrum. Det er som før nævnt også set i Danmark, selv om det officielt fortsat er uvist, hvem der stod bag/ritzau/

title: Israel: Dansk aktivist fra Gaza-flotille er blandt deporterede | Berlingske
body_text: InternationaltI dag kl. 15.45Opdateret i dag kl. 15.45Israel: Dansk aktivist fra Gaza-flotille er blandt deporteredeEn talsperson fra organisationen Free Gaza Movement bekræfter, at en dansker har været tilbageholdt i Israel.Lyt Kø Gem artikel171 aktivister fra en nødhjælpsflotille med kurs mod Gaza, som Israel stoppede i sidste uge, er blevet deporteret - herunder mindst én dansker.Det oplyser Israels udenrigsministerium i et opslag på X.Gruppen er blevet deporteret til henholdsvis Grækenland og Slovakiet.Talsperson fra organisationen Free Gaza Movement Bent Erik Krøyer bekræfter over for Ritzau, at en dansk kvinde har været tilbageholdt i Israel efter at have været om bord på et skib i flotillen.Han fortæller, at forventningen har været, at hun skulle deporteres.- Det glæder mig meget, at det formentlig er hende, der er på vej hjem. For det har været hårdt at være fængslet dernede, siger han.Aktivisterne, som er blevet deporteret, kommer fra en lang række lande.Der er foruden Danmark tale om Grækenland, Italien, Frankrig, Irland, Sverige, Polen, Tyskland, Bulgarien, Litauen, Østrig, Luxemburg, Finland, Slovakiet, Schweiz, Norge, Storbritannien, Serbien og USA.Blandt dem er den svenske aktivist Greta Thunberg, der kan ses på flere billeder, som Israels udenrigsministerium har offentliggjort på X.- Vedhæftet er billeder af Greta og andre deltagere i dette PR-stunt i lufthavnen, før de blev deporteret, skriver ministeriet.Flotillen blev arrangeret af initiativet Global Sumud Flotilla.Global Sumud Flotilla oplyste natten til torsdag i sidste uge, at Israels militær havde stoppet 13 af flotillen skibe, mens 30 skibe sejlede videre mod Gaza.De resterende skibe blev stoppet af flåden i de efterfølgende dage, og aktivisterne om bord blev transporteret til Israel.En anden flotille, som den danske folketingspolitiker Victoria Velasquez (EL) er en del af, er stadig på vej til Gaza med nødhjælp.Denne flotille befinder sig mandag i Middelhavet nord for den egyptiske by Alexandria.Ifølge Bent Erik Krøyer fra Free Gaza Movement sejler en række danskere med denne flotille./ritzau/

title: Berlingske retter artikel om tidligere imam  | Berlingske

title: Folketinget skal indhente erfaringer fra udlandet om mandatkøb | Berlingske
body_text: PolitikI dag kl. 15.32Opdateret i dag kl. 15.32Folketinget skal indhente erfaringer fra udlandet om mandatkøbJustitsminister Peter Hummelgaard (S) skal indhente erfaringer, der skal forhindre mandatkøb.Lyt Kø Gem artikelFolketinget søger mod udlandet for at indhente erfaringer, der kan bruges til at forhindre, at et mandat i Folketinget bliver købt af et parti.Det siger Folketingets formand og formand for Udvalget for Forretningsordenen (UFO) Søren Gade (V) mandag efter møde i UFO.- Nu er det blevet besluttet, at justitsministeren (Peter Hummelgaard (S), red.) indsamler erfaringer fra de lande, som har et regelsæt, hvor vi finder ud af, hvad det er for et regelsæt, de har, siger han.Folketingets lovsekretariat har fremlagt fire bud på, hvordan man kan forhindre, at partier tilbyder "økonomiske fordele" for at nedlægge et mandat.Spørgsmålet blev aktuelt, efter at Frihedsbrevet tidligere i år afslørede, at Moderaterne havde tilbudt Mike Fonseca penge for at nedlægge sit mandat.Det skete ved et møde, hvor Moderaternes formand, udenrigsminister Lars Løkke Rasmussen, fremlagde forslaget, som Mike Fonseca afviste.Sekretariatet anviser forskellige mulige veje.Enten kan man - på forskellig vis - ændre straffelovens regler for aktiv og passiv bestikkelse. Man kan ændre folketingsvalglovens regler for bestikkelse, eller man kan vedtage et kodeks.- Man kan prøve at få det ind i valgloven, i straffeloven, og man kan prøve at få et kodeks, som man har i andre lande.- Det bliver op til Folketinget at afgøre, hvilken vej man skal gå, siger Søren Gade.Sagen om Mike Fonseca og Moderaterne blev taget op af flere oppositionspartier, og i sommer krævede et flertal i Udvalget for Forretningsordenen, at mandatkøb skulle forbydes./ritzau/

title: Moderaterne opstiller otte partiansatte til kommunalvalget | Berlingske
body_text: PolitikI dag kl. 15.29Opdateret i dag kl. 15.29Moderaterne opstiller otte partiansatte til kommunalvalgetTil kommunalvalget sætter Moderaterne otte af deres partiansatte fra sekretariatet på Christiansborg på valg.Lyt Kø Gem artikelModeraterne opstiller en række af deres partiansatte i sekretariatet på Christiansborg til kommunalvalget i november.Det skriver partiet i en pressemeddelelse.Det drejer sig eksempelvis om pressechef Cecilie Fisker Nielsen, Frederiksberg, organisations- og udviklingschef Casper Hedegaard, København, og politisk chef Simon Boje Groth, København.I alt er der tale om, at otte partiansatte i Moderaternes sekretariat stiller op til kommunalvalget.- Jeg er stolt over, at så mange i partiet har lyst til at engagere sig - også vores egne medarbejdere, lyder det fra partisekretær i Moderaterne Britt Bager.Britt Bager, der har erfaring som folketingsmedlem for Venstre og De Konservative, stiller dog ikke selv op til kommunalvalget.Mandag klokken 12 var der frist for at indsende de endelige kandidatlister til valget, der løber af stablen den 18. november.Det er første gang, at Moderaterne stiller op til kommunal- og regionsrådsvalget.Partiet blev valgt ind i Folketinget for første gang ved valget i 2022, og nu skal man forsøge at blive repræsenteret i byrådene landet over.Moderaterne oplyser, at man i alt opstiller 270 kandidater i 71 kommuner.I august lød det fra partiet, at man ville være repræsenteret i 73 kommuner, og der er derfor faldet to kommuner fra i slutspurten.Ud over de nævnte partiansatte opstiller partiet også HR-chefen, Anna Peuliche Vogelsang, i Roskilde og den nationale kampagneleder, Asger Hagelund, i København.Dertil kommer de ansatte Frederik Lau Petersen, Rødovre, Andreas Raben, København, og Kasper-Peder von Bach, Odense.- Nu er holdet sat, og jeg ved, at alle vores dygtige og dedikerede kandidater er klar til at gøre en forskel i deres lokalområde, siger Britt Bager i pressemeddelelsen./ritzau/

title: Politiet beder om hjælp til at fange diamanttyv | B.T.
body_text: KrimiI dag kl. 15.51Politiet beder om hjælp til at fange diamanttyvOliver FruergaardJournalistLyt KøFyns Politi deler mandag overvågningsbilleder af en mand, der mistænkes for at stjæle en diamantring.Manden gik onsdag formiddag den 2. juni ind i en guldsmedeforretning i Odense og fortalte personalet, at han bare kiggede, skriver politiet i en pressemeddelelse.Flere gange forsøgte han at åbne en glasmontre, hvori en sjælden 119.000-kroners diamantring i 18 karat hvidguld var udstillet.Det lykkedes manden at åbne montren og luske ringen ned i sin inderlomme, mens ekspedienten var distraheret af andre kunder.Derefter forlod han butikken.Politiet eftersøger nu manden og ringen, som har teksten 'EZZE AU 750 D 1.00 CT' indgraveret. Der findes ifølge forhandleren kun én ring af denne type i hvidguld i Danmark.Ringen er en såkaldt 'Solitaire/énstensring'.Politiet beskriver manden som dansk af udseende, dansktalende og i alderen 65-75 år.Manden var klædt i beige chinos, en lyseblå skjorte, mørkeblå vest og hvide sko. Han var desuden iført briller med sort stel.

title: Nato-generalsekretær Mark Rutte besøger Danmark igen | B.T.
body_text: PolitikI dag kl. 15.48Opdateret i dag kl. 15.48Nato-generalsekretær Mark Rutte besøger Danmark igenNato meddeler, at Mark Rutte lægger vejen forbi Danmark for at mødes med statsminister Mette Frederiksen.Lyt KøForsvarsalliancen Nato meddeler på sin hjemmeside, at Natos generalsekretær, Mark Rutte, i dag, mandag, kommer til Danmark for at mødes med statsminister Mette Frederiksen (S).- Mandag 6. oktober rejser Natos generalsekretær, Mark Rutte, til København i Danmark for at mødes med den danske statsminister, Mette Frederiksen, skriver Nato på sin hjemmeside.Det fremgår ikke af meddelelsen, hvad de to skal snakke sammen om.Ritzau har været i kontakt med Statsministeriet, som hverken vil be- eller afkræfte besøget på nuværende tidspunkt.Mark Rutte var også i Danmark i sidste uge.Her var han torsdag i Bella Centret i København i forbindelse med et møde i Det Europæiske Politiske Fællesskab (EPC).Her holdt Mette Frederiksen blandt andet pressemøde med Ukraines præsident, Volodymyr Zelenskyj, hvis land siden 2022 har været i krig med nabolandet Rusland.Nato-lande har generelt været udsat for en del hændelser i den seneste tid.Det gælder også Danmark, hvor droner har fløjet over kritisk infrastruktur som lufthavne og militæranlæg.Forsvarets Efterretningstjeneste (FE) vurderede i sidste uge, at truslen for militære provokationer mod Nato-lande er høj.FE vurderer, at Rusland i øjeblikket fører en hybridkrig mod Danmark og Vesten.I vurderingen er blandt andet hensynsløs sejlads, simulerede angreb mod Nato-landes enheder og jamming af både civile og militære skibes og flys kommunikation og GPS-signaler nævnt som eksempler.Hertil kommer gentagne russiske krænkelser af Nato-landes luftrum. Det er som før nævnt også set i Danmark, selv om det officielt fortsat er uvist, hvem der stod bag/ritzau/

title: ANMELDELSE: Lil Pump, store moshpits
author: Gaffa
body_text: GAFFA – 35 år i musikkens tjeneste Af Cillian Steen Murphy / FOTO: Jan Pieter van Eerde - http://photopit.net 04.12.2018 / 10:10 / Læsetid: 4 min Arkivfoto“Opvarmning går på sikkert lidt over 20, spiller i 30 min.. så hopper der en dj op og spiller SoundCloud-musik til kl. 21 ca. Og så kommer Pump ved 21.30-tiden og spiller max 45 minutter”.Således lød den profeti, som mandag eftermiddag tikkede ind i min indbakke fra min kammerat og medkoncertgænger, op til Lil Pumps første danske koncert nogensinde i Store Vega. title: Megalopolis: An Original Graphic Novel Adapts 2024's Most Divisive Film
body_text: It's fair to say that Francis Ford Coppola's Megalopis was one of the most divisive pieces of pop culture released in 2024. IGN's Megalopolis review was pretty positive on Coppola's ambitious epic, but many reviews were far less kind. But, love it or hate it, Coppola fans now have the opportunity to experience this story in a whole new medium thanks to Francis Ford Coppola's Megalopolis: An Original Graphic Novel. With Megalopolis: An Original Graphic Novel in stores now, IGN can exclusively debut a new preview of the book. Check it out in the slideshow gallery below:Megalopolis is adapted from Coppola's screenplay and is written by Chris Ryall (Zombies vs. Robots) and illustrated by Jacob Phillips (That Texas Blood). The book is published by Abrams ComicArts. Here's the official description of the graphic novel:Set in the futuristic city of New Rome, Megalopolis originally captivated audiences with its masterful filmmaking, becoming one of Francis Ford Coppola's most widely discussed films. Now, in graphic novel form, it explores the gripping narrative of idealism versus corruption. Architect and dreamer Cesar Catilina seeks a utopian future, while Mayor Franklyn Cicero fights to preserve the status quo—rife with greed and political warfare. Caught between these powerful forces is Julia Cicero, the mayor’s daughter, whose romance with Cesar tests her loyalty and compels her to redefine her beliefs about what humanity truly deserves. The film, which features an all-star cast including Adam Driver, Giancarlo Esposito, Nathalie Emmanuel, Jon Voight, Laurence Fishburne, and Aubrey Plaza, made its world premiere last year to a 10-minute standing ovation at the prestigious Cannes Film Festival and was released theatrically and in IMAX globally on September 27, 2024."The 'Cloud Tower' sequence atop the Chrysler Building had been one of the key set pieces since the earliest days of Coppola’s development of Megalopolis. Going back decades," Ryall tells IGN about the above preview. "And it’s a very effective scene in the film, with Cesar precariously perched on the edge of the building as the wind whips clouds all around. And then, we’re not quite sure how he does it but Catalina commands time to STOP. And it does. The clouds freeze in the sky; the cars and pedestrians far below likewise stop."Ryall continues, "Which is all well and good… but how do you show that in static panels on a flat comic book page? Without the ability to freeze on a frame or use sound or moving images in a unique way to convey this, we had to find another way to stop time – luckily, that’s basically what an artist does, is stop time. In this case, we played with color, flattening the colors on the page to their basics, the world in all its rich, colorful fullness stopping all around Cesar. But even amidst the flatness of the scene, it’s the dialogue that gives it color. Cesar first utters the line that he repeats in multiple sequences, the phrase that basically dictates his approach to the world: 'I will not let time have dominion over my soul.'”Francis Ford Coppola's Megalopolis: An Original Graphic Novel is available in bookstores and comic shops now. You can order a copy on Amazon.In other comic book news, check out our exclusive previews of Adventure Time: The Bubbline College Special #1 and Dracula: Book III - The Count.Jesse is a mild-mannered staff writer for IGN. Allow him to lend a machete to your intellectual thicket by following @jschedeen on BlueSky.

title: The Latest Apple iPads Are as Much as 50% Off at the Amazon Resale Store for October Prime Day
body_text: Related reads:Every iPad Generation: A Full History of Release Dates Just for October Prime Day, Amazon has activated a 35% off coupon that works on thousands of items in its Resale store - Amazon's official outlet for used products. This includes some ridiculously good discounts on late 2024 and 2025 model Apple iPads. I've purposely selected iPad models that are available in "Like New" condition. There's a good chance these items haven't been used at all and are returns from customers who have changed their minds or simply products with blemished packaging. Resale items also get the same 30-day return policy as any other Amazon purchase.Note that the 35% off coupon is reserved for Amazon Prime members only. If you don't want to commit to an annual subscription, you can just sign up for a single month for $15.Used: Like New Apple iPads at the Amazon Resale Store2025 Apple iPad 11-inchHere's a great opportunity to score a used: like new iPad for under $200. For most people, the iPad (not the Air, Mini, or Pro) is the best model to get because it offers all the benefits of iOS as well as snappy performance at an affordable price. The current generation model was released on March 12, 2025, over two years after the previous generation (October 2022). The upgrades include a more powerful processor, more RAM, and more storage.2025 iPad Air 11-inch and 13-inchThis is the only time I've seen the (latest) 7th generation Apple iPad Air M3 tablet sell for under $300. You can pick up a used: like new 11" model for just $289 or the larger 13" model for $397. In all three cases you're saving about 50% off the retail price. The 7th gen iPad Air was released in March of 2025 and is equipped with a more powerful M3 chip. The inclusion of the M3 chip also means that the new iPad Air now supports Apple Intelligence. The iPad Air also boasts an 11" 2360x1640 (264ppi) Liquid Retina display with P3 Wide Color and True Tone that's better than the standard iPad's display.Late 2024 Apple iPad Mini 8.9-InchThe current generation Apple iPad Mini (A17 Pro) normally costs $499, but rigjt now it's less than half that price for a used: like new model at the Amazon Resale Store. The new iPad Mini was released in October of 2024 and, despite its smaller footprint, features superior hardware compared to the standard Apple iPad. For starters, it's equipped with an A17 Pro processor, which is better than the A16 Bionic found in the iPad. The iPad Mini also features a sharper 8.3" 2266x1488 display (326ppi) with P3 Wide Color and True Tone. Finally, unlike the iPad, the iPad Mini is Apple Intelligence compatible.Check out more Amazon Resale dealsThe 35% off coupon works on thousands of items at the Amazon Resale store, including popular brand names and the latest products like current generation Apple iPads, Sonos soundbars and speakers, PlayStation 5 consoles, the new Sony WH-1000XM6 headphones, PS5 video games, 4K Blu-ray movies, and much more. I've compiled a list of the most popular items that are heavily discounted for October Prime Day, including deals on more Apple devices.Eric Song is the IGN commerce manager in charge of finding the best gaming and tech deals every day. When Eric isn't hunting for deals for other people at work, he's hunting for deals for himself during his free time. Related reads:The Newest Apple iPad Drops Back to Its Lowest Price Ever Ahead of Memorial Day

title: 'We're Drowning in Mediocrity': Alien Director Ridley Scott Says Modern Movies Are So Bad He's Gone Back to Watching His Own
body_text: Related reads:Alien: Earth Provides Sympathy for the Villain by Turning Him Into Ripley Ridley Scott, the director of Alien, Gladiator and Blade Runner, has slammed the current state of the movie industry — and said the majority of new films are "s***."The sheer number of bad movies has become such a problem, Scott told Yahoo News, that he has now begun to simply rewatch his own — including Black Hawk Down, which he recalled seeing again recently and being impressed by."Right now I'm finding mediocrity," the 87-year-old said of the movie industry's output. "We're drowning in mediocrity.""The quantity of movies that are made today, literally globally, [there are] millions," Scott continued. "There's not thousands, there's millions, and most of it is shit — 80-60% 'eh,' 40% is the rest, and 25% of that 40 is not bad, and 10% is pretty good, and the top 5% is great."Scott went on to suggest that the same ratio of good and bad films existed back in the 1940s — though back then, far fewer movies were being made. Today, with so many films releasing each year, the sheer bulk of mediocrity had ballooned."I think a lot of films today are saved, and made more expensive by digital effects," he added. "Because what they haven’t got is a great [script] on paper first. Get it on paper."While Scott still perseveres with some new movies and TV shows — and uses them to scout for younger talent, he said, which is how he found Gladiator 2 star Paul Mescal after watching the actor in BBC series Normal People — he was also turning back to some of his own, older work to enjoy.“What I do — and it’s a horrible thing — but I’ve started to watch my own movies, and actually they’re really good,” Scott admitted. “And also, they don’t age … I watched Black Hawk Down the other night and I thought, ‘How the hell did I do that?’ But I think that occasionally there’s a good one that will happen, it’s like a relief that there’s somebody out there who’s doing a good movie.”Can Scott's own future work help tip the balance? For now, the director has no plans to retire. Scott recently wrapped filming on The Dog Stars, an upcoming post-apocalyptic sci-fi film starring Euphoria's Jacob Elordi. The director has also discussed plans to make a third Gladiator film, as well as a Bee Gees biopic.Photo by Sunset Boulevard/Corbis via Getty Images.Tom Phillips is IGN's News Editor. You can reach Tom at tom_phillips@ign.com or find him on Bluesky @tomphillipseg.bsky.social Related reads:Alien: Earth - The Biggest (Acid) Burning Questions After Episodes 1 and 2

title: Cult of Blood, a Retro-Inspired Survival Horror Game, Officially Announced for PC, Xbox, and PS5
body_text: Related reads:Elon Musk Promises His xAI Studio Will Release a 'Great' AI-Generated Video Game and Grok Will Make a Movie That Is 'At Least Watchable' Both Before the End of 2026 Developer Dusty Box has officially announced its old-school-inspired single-player survival-horror game, Cult of Blood. In it, you play a police officer investigating vampires who ends up discovering a secret village of worshippers in a blood cult. Dusty Box says it's inspired by a true story. It's due out next year for PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X|S.Classic Resident Evil fans might appreciate Cult of Blood's "fixed camera angles, dramatic cutscenes, and refined tank-style controls," while combat is "chaotic and unforgiving" while "ammunition is limited but not absent, forcing you to weigh every shot carefully." Check out the announcement trailer above and the first screenshots in the gallery below.You'll find new gear and be able to upgrade it using blood souls as you fight off a possible fate as the final piece of a cult priestess's ritual to ascend as a goddess. You can try out Cult of Blood for yourself by playing the demo (and/or wishlisting the game while you're there) on Steam.Ryan McCaffrey is IGN's executive editor of previews and host of both IGN's weekly Xbox show, Podcast Unlocked, as well as our monthly(-ish) interview show, IGN Unfiltered. He's a North Jersey guy, so it's "Taylor ham," not "pork roll." Debate it with him on Twitter at @DMC_Ryan. Related reads:Burger King Says It Ditched 'Creepy King' Because He Was Scaring Off Families With Kids — Who Walked Straight Into McDonald's Instead

title: Nintendo Lawsuit Demands $4.5 Million Settlement From Reddit Mod Who Sold Switch ROMs, Insists Figure Is 'Nowhere Near' an Amount That Would Compensate 'For the Seriousness of the Defendant's Conduct'
body_text: Related reads:Switch Modder Who Ignored Warnings from Nintendo and Attempted to Defend Himself Without a Lawyer Ultimately Must Pay $2 Million for Enabling Piracy Nintendo is suing a Reddit moderator and alleged Switch pirate for $4.5 million, claiming the figure is "nowhere near an amount that would compensate Nintendo of America for the seriousness of the Defendant's conduct."The conduct Nintendo references is the alleged "DMCA anti-trafficking violations" of James "Archbox" Williams, a moderator on the Switch Pirates subreddit who is accused of copying and distributing pirated Nintendo Switch games. As IGN reported at the time, Nintendo tracked down the alleged Switch pirate using a combination of Reddit posts and repair orders and sued Williams for allegedly violating its digital copyrights by selling pirated copies of Switch games. It was able to locate him via an online investigation that traced Archbox to an address in Arizona.Now, in new court papers spotted by Polygon, Nintendo has filed a 30-page complaint accusing Williams of being "directly involved in creating, operating, promoting, supporting, and/or maintaining several other Pirate Shops," as well as the "Circumvention Software to facilitate widespread use of the Pirate Shops."Nintendo said it reached out to Williams in March 2024 with a cease and desist, and claimed the defendant "acknowledged his conduct violated NOA's rights and stated he would work with NOA to satisfy demands." But the megacorp alleged that Williams "did not, however, agree to cease his conduct," denied involvement with the "pirate shops," and when NOA requested he confirm in writing that he would comply with NOA’s demands, "he became combative and uncooperative."Shortly thereafter, a number of the pirate shops became inaccessible as the defendant "deleted or hid evidence relevant to NOA's claims," Nintendo said, including many of his social media posts and his GitHub account. After the company tried again in May 2024 to give Williams "a final opportunity to comply," it then filed a complaint against the individual in June, claiming direct and indirect copyright violations. When the court gave permission for Nintendo to approach Williams' internet service providers in November 2024, the firm claimed the discovery "corroborated Williams' involvement.""NOA has been, and continues to be, damaged as a direct and proximate result of Williams’ conduct," the filing explained. "NOA has reason to believe that Williams has engaged in the infringing and unlawful reproduction and distribution of hundreds or thousands of copyrighted Nintendo Switch Games, and that through the various Pirate Shops, he has distributed or facilitated the distribution of thousands, if not hundreds of thousands, of unauthorized copies of such Nintendo Switch Games. NOA also has expended and continues to expend significant resources to halt or stem video game piracy, including through developing, implementing, and updating its TPMs and policing and investigating reports of piracy such as Williams’."Furthermore, there can be no question that Williams’ conduct was willful, and that his willfulness is sufficiently alleged by the Complaint. In any event, Williams’s own statements and actions are well-documented, and fully support that Williams actually knew his conduct was infringing or else acted with 'reckless disregard for, or willful blindness to, the copyright holder's rights.'"The company said that because of the "difficultly in assessing the precise amount of actual damages suffered by NOA, exacerbated by Williams’s deliberate default and refusal to participate in discovery," it is now seeking judgment in favor of Nintendo for a monetary award of $4.5 million and an injunction, but says it is not seeking "statutory damages windfall or punitive award," but "only" $150,000 for each title it believes Williams infringed the copyrights of, of which there are 30. It is also not pursuing recompense for its legal costs.Photo by BEHROUZ MEHRI/AFP via Getty Images.Vikki Blake is a reporter for IGN, as well as a critic, columnist, and consultant with 15+ years experience working with some of the world's biggest gaming sites and publications. She's also a Guardian, Spartan, Silent Hillian, Legend, and perpetually High Chaos. Find her at BlueSky. Related reads:Nintendo Indie World Showcase August 2025: Everything Announced

title: 'That Sort of Film Would Bore the Arse Off Me' — Ray Winstone Insists He Doesn't Regret Turning Up Drunk to His Audition With George Lucas for Padmé's Father in Star Wars: Attack of the Clones
body_text: Ray Winstone has revealed how he botched an audition for a Star Wars movie because he turned up drunk. But, as you’d expect from the Londoner best known for his "hard man" roles, he has no regrets.It turns out Winstone had an audition in front of George Lucas himself for the role of Ruwee Naberrie, Padmé’s father in Star Wars prequel movie Attack of the Clones. But he was out drinking the night before and attended the meeting drunk, which led to an awkward standoff.“It didn’t go well,” Winstone told Far Out magazine. “Had words and that was that. I’ve worked for George since, and he was fine. He didn’t remember. Or if he did, he didn’t take it to heart.”Winstone then suggested he was left unimpressed after Lucas failed to tell him he didn’t get the job himself, sending a messenger to deliver the bad - but not unexpected - news instead.“I’d been out all night, and I turned up, and I knew I was wrong for the part as soon as I walked in, but instead of saying that, he relayed the message to me through someone else, and I took umbrage at that,” Winstone said.He added that he thought Lucas had jet lag because he yawned during the audition. And then, following a period of silence, Winstone remembered he was asked a question, which sounds more like it was a directive: “Why don’t we both have a 15-minute sleep and then I’ll f**k off?”Ruwee Naberrie ended up being played by Australian actor Graeme Blundell, and Attack of the Clones made hundreds of millions at the global box office. But Winstone has no regrets, adding: “that sort of film would bore the arse off me, all that bluescreen work.”Still, it’s fun to imagine the tough-talking Londonder playing Natalie Portman’s dad in Star Wars. Bloody hell!This isn’t the first time the outspoken Winstone has recalled having a difficult time with big-budget Hollywood movie franchises. In August, Winstone spoke of his frustration with Marvel's demands for Black Widow reshoots, despite the film's director apparently being happy with his performance.Wesley is Director, News at IGN. Find him on Twitter at @wyp100. You can reach Wesley at wesley_yinpoole@ign.com or confidentially at wyp100@proton.me.

title: Feature: Valorant Champions 2025 Proves Just How Big Esports Has Become
body_text: Related reads:Interview: Valorant Executive Producer Andy Ho on the Future, Valorant on Mobile, and Valorant Champions 2025 "Gaming was once small, but now it's everywhere." With those words, the Valorant Champions Grand Finals is opened. Anyone present in Paris can confirm this. Metro stations have been completely transformed with Valorant art, and even surrounding buildings are entirely wrapped in the tournament's artwork. The fact that the final itself delivers fireworks is truly the icing on the cake. In five years, Valorant has grown into one of the biggest esports in the world. A completely sold-out Accor Arena in Paris, the final stop of the Valorant Champions 2025 tournament, proves this. World artists like Katy Perry, Lady Gaga, and Gojira will perform here later this year, but this weekend, it has been completely taken over by fanatic Valorant fans. They are watching Fnatic against NRG in the final, with the former clearly being the crowd favorite. Perhaps you've been to a match of your favorite sports team, or watched the opening of the Olympic Games or the FIFA World Cup on TV. Riot Games is no stranger to organizing major competitions, and you can feel that in the arena. Even if you don't care much for Valorant, you can't escape the goosebumps the opening ceremony causes. The atmosphere inside the venue where two titans fight for the world title remains something unique. There is also a huge difference between top Valorant players and, for example, League of Legends players. Where the GOAT Faker always plays like a robot, the games in Valorant look very different. Players challenge each other, perform real-life emotes even during the walk-out, and seize every opportunity to get under their opponent's skin. The great appeal of these tournaments is fantastically clear during the third map. Fnatic is down 2-0 in matches and is looking at an 11-1 deficit. NRG is playing almost flawlessly, and while there was room for dances and trash talk towards the opponent at the start, the frustration and defeat are etched on the faces of the Fnatic players during the first timeout on the third map. Conversely, the NRG players are clearly gaining more and more confidence and pulling off one impressive play after another. It looks like a player like me is taking on a Radiant player, and that's almost too painful to watch. The miracle that unfolds next is something out of a fairy tale, albeit with a sour ending for Fnatic. Maybe it's the pressure on NRG or the light that Fnatic saw. Because the latter manages to fight back incredibly to 12-12, and eventually, the European team secures a 13-15 win to bring the score to 2-1. For a moment, Fnatic seems on its way to an insane comeback, even managing to tie it up at 2-2. Unfortunately, the final map or the pressure doesn't favor Fnatic, and NRG deservedly wins the Valorant Champions 2025. It is a true treat for everyone present. The biggest comeback on the biggest Valorant stage ever and the emotion that is unleashed by NRG after they finally manage to clinch the win. Tears of joy in the eyes of NRG mada and tears of sadness from Boaster, the player who regularly put the opponent to shame with a dance or big mouth both before and during the matches. Despite the clear preference of the audience for Fnatic, NRG is also cheered on until the very end. In fact, when NRG scores a flawless round, they are applauded. There is an unstated brotherhood among the fans, which always creates an amicable yet tense atmosphere in the building. Because that tension lingers until the last moment. Fans continue to cheer on Fnatic until the very end, even when the neutral viewer already realizes it's a lost cause for them. It culminates in a big celebration for the winners and a somewhat sad departure for the team that just couldn't quite make it. Valorant Champions 2025 ultimately shows that Riot knows how to stage a major tournament like no other. League of Legends, Valorant, and perhaps Riftbound in the future are all highlights of the esports year. If you have the opportunity to attend one of the upcoming major tournaments, you should definitely do it.

title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 Beta Extended by 24 Hours, Ends Just a Day Before the Battlefield 6 Release Date
body_text: Related reads:Battlefield 6 Leaks Seem Unstoppable as Players Report Receiving Copies Days Before Launch Good news, Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 fans — Activision has extended its open beta to run an additional 24 hours to October 9, taking it right up to competitor Battlefield 6's release, which is slated for October 10."The reaction to the Black Ops 7 Beta so far has been awesome to see! Whether you’re calling in Nukes in Multiplayer or going for high rounds in Zombies Survival, there’s plenty to jump into and we've had a ton of fun playing alongside everyone," Activision wrote in its latest blog."On behalf of all of us at Treyarch, we’re truly grateful for your feedback so far... and speaking of which, we heard you might want a little more, so we’re extending the Black Ops 7 Beta to 9am PT on Thursday, October 9!"The beta now includes sixth Beta MP map, Toshin, and Open playlists, which have classic matchmaking where skill is minimally considered, Activision said.Activision also confirmed it will be extending 2XP + 2X Weapon XP through the rest of the Beta "to help everyone hit level 30, try out all the weapons and gear, and unlock plenty of attachments and Overclocks along the way."If you’re looking to jump into the beta while it's live, we've got a guide on how to get into the BO7 Early Access Beta, plus how to enable Secure Boot for BO7 if you’re on PC. We’ve also got details of all the BO7 unlockable weapons, and the BO7 Twitch drops you can get your hands on.Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 extended beta features:MAPS• MP: Toshin (NEW), Blackheart, Cortex, Exposure, Imprint, The Forge• Zombies: Vandorn Farm (extended to end of Beta)PLAYLISTS• MP: Open Moshpit, Moshpit, Open Hardcore Moshpit, Search & Destroy (NEW), Training Course• Zombies: Survival, Training CourseMODES• Team Deathmatch (Core + Hardcore)• Domination (Core + Hardcore)• Hardpoint• Kill Confirmed• Overload• Search & DestroyBlack Ops 7 has set its official release date for November 14. This week, Activision revealed that 97% of Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 cheaters were caught within 30 minutes of signing into the beta, and "fewer than 1% of cheating attempts reached a match." PC gamers cannot play unless they enable TPM 2.0 and Secure Boot.As for Battlefield 6? EA's shooter has suffered numerous leaks throughout 2025, and now, just three days before launch, the game itself may have leaked its way into the public’s hands, too.Vikki Blake is a reporter for IGN, as well as a critic, columnist, and consultant with 15+ years experience working with some of the world's biggest gaming sites and publications. She's also a Guardian, Spartan, Silent Hillian, Legend, and perpetually High Chaos. Find her at BlueSky. Related reads:Battlefield 6 Global Release Times Confirmed

title: Robin Williams’ Daughter Takes Stand Against AI Slop Exploiting Her Father’s Image
body_text: Zelda Williams, daughter of Robin Williams and the director of 2024 horror comedy Lisa Frankenstein, has issued a firm ultimatum for fans to stop sending her AI-generated videos featuring her father.“Please, just stop sending me AI videos of Dad,” wrote Williams in a message posted via Instagram. “Stop believing I wanna see it or that I’ll understand, I don’t and I won’t. If you’re just trying to troll me, I’ve seen way worse, I’ll restrict and move on. But please, if you’ve got any decency, just stop doing this to him and to me, to everyone even, full stop. It’s dumb, it’s a waste of time and energy, and believe me, it’s not what he’d want.”Willams is adamant in her disgust for AI-generated content and the culture around it.“To watch the legacies of real people be condensed down to ‘this vaguely looks and sounds like them so that’s enough’, just so other people can churn out horrible TikTok slop puppeteering them is maddening,” her statement explained. “You’re not making art, you’re making disgusting, over-processed hotdogs out of the lives of human beings, out of the history of art and music, and then shoving them down someone else’s throat hoping they’ll give you a little thumbs up and like it. Gross.”“And for the love of everything, stop calling it ‘the future,’ AI is just badly recycling and regurgitating the past to be reconsumed. You are taking in the Human Centipede of content, and from the very, very end of the line, all while the folks at the front laugh and laugh, consume and consume.”Williams’ new comments echo concerns she raised previously in 2023 about the use of AI to emulate the voices of actors who cannot consent to it. “I’ve witnessed for years how many people want to train these models to create/recreate actors who cannot consent, like Dad,” she wrote at the time. “This isn’t theoretical, it is very, very real.”Williams’ comments came in support of the Screen Actors Guild's (SAG) fight against AI.Robin Williams died in August 2014. The Academy Award-winning actor and comedy icon was 63.Luke is a Senior Editor on the IGN reviews team. You can track him down on Bluesky @mrlukereilly to ask him things about stuff.

title: World of Warcraft Leads Say the Worldsoul Saga Will Eventually Address the Sword of Sargeras: 'Metzen Promised and Metzen Doesn't Lie'
body_text: Related reads:World of Warcraft is getting two major changes in Midnight that are already dividing the community There's an elephant in the room in every discussion of World of Warcraft's upcoming expansion, Midnight. Or should I say, a sword. A really, really big sword.I'm talking about the Sword of Sargeras, an absolutely colossal weapon bigger than a mountain that Sargeras stabbed into the planet several expansions ago and has since just been sitting there, unaddressed, probably doing something awful to the planet.For years now, WoW fans have been asking if we were ever going to, you know, do something about that. And Blizzard has been very, very coy when asked. But answers are coming, says game director Ion Hazzikostas, if not in Midnight, then at least by the end of the Worldsoul Saga.As a recap, the Sword of Sargeras is the sword of, well, the Titan Sargeras, which he stabbed directly into the planet at the end of WoW's Legion expansion as he's being kicked out of Azeroth. Initially, it's poisoning the planet, but players use their Legion Artifact weapons to suck out the poison and buy the planet time before the sword does...something to it. Though the sword was discussed further in the following expansion, Battle for Azeroth, it's since been largely forgotten from a plot standpoint. Instead, it's just...sitting there in the middle of Silithus.And really, I can't emphasize enough, this thing is huge. You can see it from several zones away! Doesn't anyone think this is a problem?At BlizzCon 2023, when the Worldsoul Saga was announced, there was a brief moment of joy that Blizzard might finally pull the sword from the planet, or at least do something with it. There was an enormous statue of the sword in the convention hall, complete with the meme-ified "What sword?" caption. Hazzikostas even wore a shirt emblazoned with "What Sword?". At the time, Warcraft executive creative director Chris Metzen confirmed that we would see the resolution of the Sword Problem in the final piece of the trilogy, The Last Titan.But The Last Titan can't come soon enough, and The War Within and everything we've seen of Midnight so far remain notably sword-less. So in a conversation with Hazzikostas and WoW lead UX designer Crash Reed, I asked them about the sword. What's the deal? Will we finally do something about it in Midnight?"What sword?" both of them intoned in response, simultaneous and predictable. I laughed. Yeah, okay. I deserved that.But Hazzikostas did go on. We will do something about it. "Before the Worldsoul Saga is over. Metzen promised and Metzen doesn't lie."So hang in there, everyone. Just like, the rest of this expansion, all of the next one, and presumably all or most of The Last TItan left to go.For our impressions of all the bits of Midnight we've seen so far, sans add-ons, check out our preview of the new expansion. You can also read more from the same interview with Hazzikostas and Reed, specifically their response to the changes around WoW add-ons in Midnight. Rebekah Valentine is a senior reporter for IGN. You can find her posting on BlueSky @duckvalentine.bsky.social. Got a story tip? Send it to rvalentine@ign.com. Related reads:Housing brings the world back into World of Warcraft - WoW: Midnight Preview
